Mission 15: Unit Conversion

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION] A B-Rank Gate has been detected. Difficulty: Advanced. Hunter, prepare to master the Dimensional Conversion Arts!

The Challenge Awaits

Young Hunter, you've reached the final gate of this training arc. Here you learn one of the most practical skills: unit conversionâ€”translating measurements between systems.

Whether calculating potion volumes in milliliters or measuring dungeon corridors in meters, a Hunter who can convert units never gets lost in dimensional confusion!

âš”ï¸ Hunter's Arsenal (Gear Checklist)

Gather these exact items before entering the Gate: - A ruler (with both inches and centimeters) - A few items to measure (including two books or boxes) - Paper to record measurements

ğŸ¯ Mission Objectives

Upon completion of this Gate, you will have unlocked: - Ratio-Based Conversion - Use ratios to convert units of measurement (6.RP.3d) - Dimensional Accuracy - Change units correctly when multiplying or dividing (6.RP.3d)

ğŸ“– The Hunter's Knowledge (Brain Download)

The Conversion Formula

To convert units, multiply by a conversion factor:

1 inch = 2.54 centimeters

To convert inches â†’ centimeters:
Multiply by 2.54

To convert centimeters â†’ inches:
Divide by 2.54

Common Conversions

Imperial Metric
1 inch 2.54 cm
1 foot (12 in) 30.48 cm
1 yard (3 ft) 0.914 m
1 mile 1.609 km

Volume Conversion

When you convert LENGTH, the VOLUME conversion is cubed:

1 inch = 2.54 cm

For VOLUME:
1 inÂ³ = (2.54)Â³ cmÂ³
1 inÂ³ = 16.387 cmÂ³

That's because volume = L Ã— W Ã— H
Each dimension gets converted!

The Volume Formula

Volume = Length Ã— Width Ã— Height
V = l Ã— w Ã— h

Units: in Ã— in Ã— in = inÂ³ (cubic inches)
       cm Ã— cm Ã— cm = cmÂ³ (cubic centimeters)

Video Lessons: - Measuring Video - Unit Conversion | CK-12 Foundation

ğŸ—¡ï¸ The Quest (Activity)

ğŸ“œ Verbatim Instructions:

Today we will all be measuring things around our house and keeping track of what we measure. We will write down what we find out and can tell each other what we learned when we are done.

Measure the length, width and height of the book using inches. Record your answers and then figure out the volume of a book by using the formula V=lwh (Volume=lengthwidthheight). This will give you an answer in inches cubed, or inÂ³.

Next convert your measurements to centimeters from inches using the ratio 1 inch = 2.54 centimeters. Figure out the volume again this time in cmÂ³.

Discussion Questions: - Which did you measure? - What was the most challenging task? Why?

Example:
L = 9 inches
W = 6 inches
H = 1.5 inches

Phase 2: Calculate Volume in InchesÂ³

V = L Ã— W Ã— H
V = 9 Ã— 6 Ã— 1.5
V = 81 cubic inches (inÂ³)

Phase 3: Convert to Centimeters

Each measurement Ã— 2.54:

L = 9 Ã— 2.54 = 22.86 cm
W = 6 Ã— 2.54 = 15.24 cm
H = 1.5 Ã— 2.54 = 3.81 cm

Phase 4: Calculate Volume in CentimetersÂ³

V = L Ã— W Ã— H
V = 22.86 Ã— 15.24 Ã— 3.81
V = 1,327.55 cubic centimeters (cmÂ³)

Phase 5: Verify Your Conversion

Check: 81 inÂ³ Ã— 16.387 = 1,327.35 cmÂ³

Close to our calculated 1,327.55 cmÂ³ âœ“
(Small difference due to rounding)

Claude Code Training

[TRAINING PROTOCOL ACTIVATED]
Before attempting the assignment, you must train with your AI companion. Claude will guide you through the concepts and verify your understanding.

Step 1: Open Your Terminal

Open a terminal on your computer and run this command to start Claude Code:

claude --dangerously-skip-permissions

Step 2: Summon Your Guide

Copy and paste this prompt to begin your training:

Hey Claude, I'm Hunter Hyro on Mission 15 - the FINAL MATH MISSION about unit conversion.
I need to master converting units before my measurement assignment.

Be my training guide and:
1. Explain how conversion factors work as ratios
2. Show me inches to centimeters (Ã— 2.54) with examples
3. Give me 3 conversion problems (length and then VOLUME)
4. Quiz me: Convert a box's volume from cubic inches to cubic centimeters
5. Have me explain WHY volume conversion uses the factor CUBED

Only tell me "Quest Unlocked" when I truly understand. Don't let me skip ahead!
This is the final math boss - make sure I really understand before clearing me!
Start with simple length conversion, then build to the volume challenge.

Step 3: Complete Your Training

Work through all phases with Claude:

  • Phase 1: Learn the concept (Claude explains)
  • Phase 2: Answer checkpoint questions
  • Phase 3: Complete 3 skill trials
  • Phase 4: Pass the Boss Challenge
  • Phase 5: Teach the concept back to Claude

You cannot proceed until Claude says "Quest Unlocked"!

Hunter's Wisdom: Unit conversion is about maintaining EQUALITY. When you multiply by 2.54 cm/inch, you're not changing the actual sizeâ€”just expressing it in different units. The object stays the same; only your description changes!
